name: Chicken Spiedies (Lemon- and Herb-Marinated Grilled Chicken Sandwiches)
description: A regional treat of Binghamton, New York, these super marinated cubes of chicken are skewered, grilled, and then delivered to a soft roll to make one amazing sandwich.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup freshly squeezed juice from about 3 lemons
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 1/2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
6 bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes prior to use

recipeInstructions.text: To make the marinade, whisk together oil, vinegar, lemon juice, parsley, basil, mint, oregano, and garlic. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Place chicken in large resealable plastic bag. Pour in marinade, seal, and toss to combine. Place in refrigerator and allow to marinate for at least overnight, up to 3 days.
When ready to cook, thread chicken onto skewers, dividing meat equally between each skewer.

Light one chimney full of charcoal. When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and spread the coals evenly over coal grate. Alternatively, set all the burners of a gas grill to medium-high heat. Set cooking grate in place, cover grill and allow to preheat for 5 minutes. Clean and oil the grilling grate. Grill skewers until chicken is browned on all sides and cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Open roll and lay grilled skewer inside. Gripping the roll at the bottom, carefully slide skewer off, leaving meat in the bread. Serve immediately.
